website_summaries.verdict: A great exfoliating soap bar if you're looking for seriously clean skin.
pros: Made with olive oil, coconut oil, soybean oil, Shea butter, activated charcoal, sand, oatmeal, and pine tar
Features a pleasant pine/earth smell and exfoliates well
cons: Not ideal for sensitive skin and the smell can be overpowering at first

customer_reviews.title: Black sludge
customer_reviews.text: Wow 4 plus stars from 167 reviews. I love artisan soaps, buy them all the time. Saw this one and said ooooo sounds good let’s give this a try. Ordered 3 bars with glee for the savvy price. OMG horrible. Why? Super medicinal smell, completely gone in less that 15 showers, ooozes a black sludge down my marble shower and even etched the finish off the marble tile after one bar! Uber bad folks. So wanted it to be amazing but not even close hence a review that I seldom offer.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Hardee

customer_reviews.title: TRY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy Dr squatch soap but it is 7 bucks a bar plus shipping this soap is a better product lasts longer and is priced much better with prime shipping,I would recomend this product to you if your a fan of this soap,It smells great has the grit for cleaning and is an awsome product!! Buy it you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Indaskys

customer_reviews.title: I am HOOKED on this soap!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to pine tar soap, hoping it would help my dry skin. I started with a brand that was touted as “one of the best” by many of the reviews I read. Apparently those testers never tried THIS soap. I tried Oliver Rocket next and I won’t be looking any further. This soap is GREAT! It lathers nicely, smells really good and it lasts long...all of the things that “other” soap lacks. What’s better is that my skin looks and feels great, which is why I switched to pine tar soap in the first place. I am totally hooked and am off to go buy more!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad soap, just not pinetar soap
customer_reviews.text: While this soap may contain pinetar, marketing it as "pinetar soap" feels very disingenuous. The smell is much more spiced and herbal, doesn't have the same mellow musky natural smell from other brands. The constant black run off also makes me question the integrity of the ingredients, I've not had other pinetar soaps do this, gives me the impression that there's something artificial about the color. Finally the texture quickly softens, going to move the bar to the soap dish after finishing showering the texture was almost gelatinous. Overall there's nothing inherently wrong with this soap as far as soap goes, it's just not what's expected when you but specifically "pinetar soap".
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quality soap for a low price
customer_reviews.text: This soap will be in our showers for now on! Everyone in my house likes it. My son had some dry itchy scalp because he wasnt rinsing his hair very well and we used this on his scalp and hair and no more ichy flakey head:)yay!it didn't over dry his hair either. I get little bumps on the back of my arms and using this soap is really helping making my skin smoother and softer. The soap came well packaged, on time and very big bars, they should last awhile. You can't best the price for quality soap:) good for the whole family:)
customer_reviews.author: happy family

customer_reviews.title: Found my soap
customer_reviews.text: This is my new soap. Scratchy and textured enough to feel like you're cleaning yourself off, but not even close to brutal. Quite pleasant. Scent is great on the bar, 5/5. Pine. Scent retention on you isn't great though. One minor drawbacks. 3.5/5 Ingredients: 5/5 Cost: 5/5 NO. SOAP. SCUM. ON. TUB. 6/5 Size/Shape/Grip: 5/5 Clean/soft skin after: 4/5 Lasts FOREVER. Maybe the longest lasting soap I've ever used. 6/5 I told you. This is my soap now. Don't even know how long to set up my subscription cause it's gonna last so dang long.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Dixon

customer_reviews.title: You will become addicted
customer_reviews.text: This soap is simply the best soap I have ever used, it really cleans your skin and the smell you almost get addicted to it. It dosnt last as long as the soaps you buy in the store however if you keep it out of running water you’ll do fine. There is another brand that smells just like this however it’s 4 times as much. One mor thing. I have to hide the soap or everyone will use. Lol. I’ve become stingy with the soap Update—- my 3rd order. Still love this stuff
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Booth

customer_reviews.title: You will be happy. Just as great of a product as the expensive competitor.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of paying $6 a bar under a stupid soapscription, so I tried this. Very happy with it and will continue to buy it. For those that never tried it, it smells like a campfire. Im a machinist who is mostly unkempt, so don't think this soap is only for pretty boys who use more products than their girlfriends. This is a man's soap, and your girlfriends and wives will love the way you and the shower smells when you use it. If there is soap in heaven I bet this is the only kind.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Wash, Rinse & Repeat! YES PLEASE! OLIVER ROCKET, RULES!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this soap is AWESOME! I waited & waited for their competitor to deliver but sadly, after a lengthy process I gave up & tried this brand. Not only do you get 3X's the amount, the scent is incredible. Moisturizing Bar Soap? You bet! This brand leaves you silky smooth! Truly does. I was quite skeptical but proven wrong. Suffice to say, I'll be buying solely from "Oliver Rocket" here on out! Highly recommend! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Bode Ghost Productions 👻

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My husband actually received a bar of this in his stocking for Christmas one year from his sister. He didn't use it very often so it lasted about a year. He has very oily skin, making this soap a good buy for him. We tried a regular bar of activated charcoal and it just wasn't the same. I recently bought him these and tried it out myself. I absolutely love the smell and feel of the soap; however, my skin isn't nearly as oily as his so I won't be using it very often. I still love this product, because it left me feeling clean and not layered down with chemicals. This product is definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: AlyJay

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed for the worse.
customer_reviews.text: It seems that they have made three significant changes to this soap, two of which I think are not improvements: 1. They have changed the scent. It is no floral-ish, and much stronger. Some may like this, but it is completely different than the 9 other bars I have gone through 2. They've removed the rough bits for exfoliation. It is now a smooth soap, which is not how this was marketed for all previous orders. 3. They've changed the shape. This seems to be an improvement as it will make the soap easier to hold. However, I didn't test this because of points 1 and 2 above. I won't order this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sprott

customer_reviews.title: Great mild all natural soap
customer_reviews.text: This is a great soap and value for the money. You get three bars for what most other bars charge for only one bar. It has a unique woodsy scent and leaves your skin with a squeaky clean feel. I just leave it on a wire rack so it can dry between showers and it doesn't drip or discolor my shower.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: It's just a personal preference as to why I don't like them. It's difficult to keep this soap from becoming soft and they contain a ton of charcoal which really shows in any white shower, so I end up having to clean it more. I know they let all the customers know about this, but once again, personal preference. The quality is good though.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: As good as Squatch and lasts waaaaaay longer.
customer_reviews.text: So I first got into these artisan soaps because of Dr Squatch but the bar was 10$ a bar? It lasted literally 2 weeks. Barely. So I love the smell of pine tar so I decided to give this one a try. 3 bars, TWICE the thickness of Dr Squatch bars. 3 Bars for 13$ vs ONE BAR for 10$???? Yeah lets try it!!!!!!! Well, after a week, I love it, it is lasting much longer, twice as long cause of the thickness of the bar. Will be buying this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and Scent
customer_reviews.text: Oliver Rocket Pine Tar Soap is the real deal. This soap smells amazing and really leaves my skin feeling great! I've tried other brands like Dr. Squatch that are around $10 a bar and Oliver Rocket is pretty close to the same scent. Oliver Rocket is much cheaper and you get 3 bars. It lasts longer than other brands as well. I can't ask for a better soap. I am not sure of the other scents but I'd love to find out. You wont be disappointed choosing these guys!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Harig

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: We've tried many other brands of coal tar soaps, and liked alot of them. But this one so far is my husbands favorite. He uses it for body, beard and hair. When he opened the last bar he asked me to order more, he didnt want to run out of it. I like the way it moisturizes, seems to help with dry itchy skin. I dont really like the scent so much or how it stains the washcloths, but other than those issues we will continue to reorder.
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Nice soap but has issues.
customer_reviews.text: If you like the overpriced Dr. Squatch pine tar soap you will like this one. Has almost the same smell, only difference it feels like the Dr. Squatch had more fragrances and felt more synthetic. Will buy this again! EDIT: After using this for a bit its a nice soap however the fragrance of the pine tar does not last long. Soon after a shower you do not smell of anything. Also after a few uses my white bottom shower was a tint of black.
customer_reviews.author: W. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: helped my dandruff
customer_reviews.text: I really like the scent of this soap. It reminds me of balsam fir trees up north. It makes my skin feel very clean, but not dried out. I even use it on my scalp instead of shampoo. Some soaps will really make my hair frizzy if I try that. But this one makes my hair feel clean, & shiny as well. It has helped my dandruff problem a great deal. My only complaint is that I wish it were cheaper. But I plan to buy it again anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Anole Watcher Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pine/Coal Tar Soap!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first soap purchase, and given past experiences with pine and coal far soaps for treating dyshidrotic eczema I was sceptical. I am.delihhted to report this is a fantastic soap. The bricks are large and feel.good in your hand, the lather is thick and luscious, and my skin feels so clean and moisturized after washing. I use this soap for hand washing to keep my skin from cracking in cold weather, and when I have eczema blisters to soothe and moisturized them. I also wash my face with it morning and evening. My skin has never felt better or cleaner. A+++ soap for people with eczema (and probably psoriasis, though I have no experience with that).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Golden

customer_reviews.title: This soap is the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: After decades of using various name brand bar soap and body wash, I made the move to pine tar soap. I've used a few different brands and settled on Oliver Rocket. It smells great and doesn't leave my skin dry and itchy like those name brand bar soaps and body washes did. The only downside I've found is how easily this pine tar soap can dissolve if left in wet areas or, if you're like me, have other family members use the shower. That said, I just purchased a very affordable porous soap holder and moved the soap where it won't be in direct contact with water. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and highly recommend Oliver Rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Robgoblin

customer_reviews.title: Great Soap But Does Not Last Long
customer_reviews.text: This is great soap, but 3 bars lasted only 3 weeks. I'm single, shower about 8-12 minutes 6-8 times per week, and I don't have and bizarre scrubbing habits. This soap should absolutely last longer than it does.
customer_reviews.author: ESR

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to write a review every day until I run out of space... (does Amazon limit you??)
customer_reviews.text: Day 1: My wife messages me after Amazon has delivered. "Your new soap smells amazing" I wash myself with it and it's pretty good. I like it. Day 2: It left a black streak in the tub as I left it in my fancy bar soap scrubby and it drip dried. It did make the scrubby hard. So that was kinda cool. Note to self order soap dish.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Shook

customer_reviews.title: I love pine tar soap
customer_reviews.text: I love pine tar soap, grew up using Packer's Pine Tar Soap. This soap has a strong perfumy fragrance that I can tolerate but the rest of the family hates the smell, nothing like the smoky smell regular pine tar soap like Grandpa's or Packer's has. It was a 3 pack, and I had to wrap up the first bar that I used twice in plastic wrap to keep the smell in. I'm sure it's fine for most but not for me..
customer_reviews.author: Ahnko Chee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this bar soap
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. If you have skin troubles & dry skin due to hormones or type 2 diabetes this soap is excellent. The odor does nit stay on your skin. It is do great as a beard wash & Conditioner. & it is better than a dandruff shampoo & shampoo clarifier. Women or men. You can’t go wrong with this soap. Un less you are alergic to any ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: VINNY

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well and an alternative to the Grandpa Soap co.
customer_reviews.text: I like the Grand Pa Soap company product but it has taken a huge price increase lately. This soap cleans well and has a unique combination of cleansers. It is worth a try in this respect. Now that the winter is over, it will take longer to see the moisturizing qualities. It does seem to dissolve quickly and so far it does not seem to last as long for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This is just like the Dr
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal at the right price. I've tried Grandpas pine tar and Dr. Squatch soap as well. Grandpas soap doesn't not have a piney smell to it. This is just like the Dr. Squatch soap (I wonder if it is the same but packaged differently), however you get 3 bars for $14 with this, and it's $7 for 1 bar from Dr. Squatch. Buy this, you won't be disappointed and you'll get more bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: best soap I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about two months and this product is amazing! The smell is absolutely wonderful, great exfoliant for the skin, and it make my hair very soft and smooth. The only problem I had was keeping it where water would puddle up after the shower, which made the soap too soft. Once the used a metal rack for it, its been great. Pros: best smelling soap I've tried great for skin, all natural does wonders to hair leaves the bathroom smelling great cons: becomes soft and almost unusable if you leave it on a flat surface where it can't dry properly (just put it in a metal wire soap holder thing and you'll be great.
customer_reviews.author: Sukhraj

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite soap!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it exfoliates as I lather. It smells REALLY good! Bonus, you can stop using glade plug-ins or scented candles in your bathroom, because after using this soap, it'll keep putting off pine scent for days. It's so good! I like the fact that it's cut into no-nonsense bricks and uses minimal no-nonsense packaging. It stands so well on its own merit that there was no need to gild this lily.
customer_reviews.author: Luke A.

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great... Not so anymore...
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a great exfoliating soap. There used to be sand in the soap that did a great job cleaning my skin and preventing acne. The new formula uses salt and while it does have some abrasive properties it is not the same anymore. The reason for the one star is because when I purchased the soap the listing was still the old one. After the soap arrived I checked on Amazon to make sure I had ordered the correct soap and sure enough I had and the listing had changed. I feel a little cheated that I received something different than I ordered and the soap is nowhere near as good as it used to be...
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Hardman

customer_reviews.title: Not What I was Expexting
customer_reviews.text: While I had high hopes, over all I wasn’t pleased. For me, it doesn’t have the strong pine tar smell I wanted like in other “grandads” does. My biggest complaint is the coloring. If you’re like most people and have a white shower, be prepared for black residue all over that you have to clean to avoid black streaks all over.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Trust the negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: Don’t make the mistake I did, trust what the negative reviews tell you about this product. Scratchy, and not just a little. Black soap = black spots if you don’t rinse the tub/shower thoroughly. I don’t like the smell, I know some do, just not me. I will not re purchase this soap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as good!
customer_reviews.text: This is just as good or even better than the $10.00 per bar soap. It does not come with fancy packing, just enough to get to you safely. I cut my bars in half and have used this soap for about 8 days. It smells very good and cleans very well. Just remember to not leave it where running water will get to it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Smells great but doesn’t hold up well (may be just bad S & H)
customer_reviews.text: I’m not blaming the company (entirely) but the soap arrived in bad shape when I actually opened it it started to break apart, after using it the first night it started to crumble in my hands. I also have been waiting for this soap all weekend as hurricane Hannah hit my town (not cool) I do love the smell and exfoliating lather but I am not sure if the damage affected it’s ability to hold up or if the next one will will just crumble, sadly I will be asking for a refund. The plain package it arrived in was also a let down but that’s just me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice smell, doesn't dry skin
customer_reviews.text: Love this soap! It has a fresh and clean scent that isn't overpowering and doesn't smell like kitchen cleaners. The natural grit doesn't scratch my skin. I cut the soap in two and use half in the showers and half in my drawer to keep it smelling good. It melts quite easily and that is a good indicator that it is doesn't contain chemicals and it is natural. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mycaru

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you like pine smell
customer_reviews.text: Strong pine smell (which my wife and I enjoy). Works well on my skin, great for my face paired with an exfoliating cloth. Also great at getting rid of armpit and personal area smells.
customer_reviews.author: Bz

customer_reviews.title: great soap
customer_reviews.text: I tried pine tar soap while back and really liked it the more I used other soaps the more I liked pine tar although I liked it the price kept me looking for alternatives but then I stumbled onto this soap Im happy with quality and the price is good enough for my tight a-- to live with
customer_reviews.author: willie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Worth It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this soap! The size is normal and the sent is exactly what I want from Pine Tar. I would recommend this one over the other more expensive ones. Compared to Dr. Squatch, this bar is bigger, smells stronger, and less expensive. You definitely get more for your buck with this soap. I am a customer for life!!! My only issue is it comes wrapped in plastic, so make sure to open the package when it comes in. Natural soaps, unless fully dry, won't last as long. If you want the bar to last longer, open the package and let it air dry for a month or so before using. Plan ahead :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Where is the Pine?
customer_reviews.text: This soap is mostly scentless. Thee is a faint smell of mix between Ivy soap and Dial plan orange hand soap . I bought this pine tar soap for the smell of pine tar and it is utterly missing in this soap. There isn't even a faint hint of it. On the upside this soap really does leave your skill feeling smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Smells like a pine Forest.
customer_reviews.text: Only on the 3rd day of use, love the smell and the clean feeling. Not sure on the moisturizing aspect skin feels the same as using Dove products. Other than that I love the minimal packaging, would be better wrapped in a parchment or was paper instead of shrink plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Nice scent
customer_reviews.text: I use pine tar soap often for dry skin. This brand has a strong smell of being in a pine forrest, which I really like. Some other brands smell more smokey or burnt. Bars are really large and last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: These soaps smell like Comet
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I am not liking these soaps. I usually use Method body wash, wanted to try something different with a nice scent. These soaps smell just like Comet. I just received them, only used them once so if they turn out to help my skin I will increase their rating.
customer_reviews.author: MindTrue

customer_reviews.title: OR just as good as Dr. Squatch.....but much cheaper
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bar of the pine tar scented soap from Dr Squatch. I love the scent and it was a good exfoliant. I saw the OR in Amazon that was priced at about 1/3 of the other brand. Thought I would try it. I could not tell the difference. The scents were equally great. I loved the gritty exfoliating capability. The only thing the neither soap did was let me carry the scent once out of the shower. I would have continued paying $10 for the Dr. S, if I didn’t stumble across the OR branded pine tar soap. Save your money and go with OR.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Loved how it smells when I shower, but it doesn't last afterwards. I do like the natural exfoliate added, good for a bar soap. I have to say however, this soap does not last long. You will be lucky to get 10 showers per bar, I didn't even get that.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Buy this right now and enjoy how you feel later
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people complain about this product so much. I'm just starting bar number two and it has lasted well over three weeks. It makes me feel nice and clean at the same time not putting any weird perfume stuff on me. Use a washcloth like you're supposed to and don't cover your whole body with the soap like a some type of thing you put in the bathtub to soak yourself with. It works amazing.
customer_reviews.author: The Vails

customer_reviews.title: All-Around Great
customer_reviews.text: This soap is perfect for both moisturizing and exfoliating, and smells very fresh and natural, like standing in a forest of pine trees. One tip, though: keep this soap on a shelf or soap dish by itself, as it will dissolve into mush within a week if it's kept in a place where water puddles around it. However, the fact that it dissolves so quickly is also great because it washes off of your skin in seconds and leaves no oily feeling behind, unlike some pine tar soaps I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha W.

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works
customer_reviews.text: Great Price for the amount you receive.I use this product as facial cleaner. This works perfect for my washing my face as a man.Most facial cleaners over dry my face after washing. This has my face feeling smooth, clean and not dry.The smell isn't bad or too strong for me. I will definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: David J Young Jr

customer_reviews.title: This soap is TREMENDOUS
customer_reviews.text: This was my second try at homemade soap. I was tired of Soap in general that dried out my skin and made me feel grippy and on some occasions, itchy. I like the Pine Tar soap, the scent isn’t too strong, it’s a great price and it soaps up really nice. I’ve used it for two weeks, bought a 3-pack and gave the other two to my family. They loved it as well! The ladies of the family also didn’t mind the smell, some even said they decided to try it as well and told me they liked it. Will continue to purchase from Oliver Rocket as long as quality and greatness remains the same! THANKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Best soap ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best soaps I have ever used! Smells great, lathers really good and my skin feels great after my shower. I even use it on my hair and it is better than most shampoos! You can't beat the price either. Less than half the cost of the other guys! I'll be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: DaddyGo

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: Not the most gritty exfoliating soap which is fine. Smell strongly of pachouli and less like anything else. One bar being used once per day and kept out of water after use, lasts about three weeks. I honestly am very happy with this soap.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Mild but woodsy
customer_reviews.text: All these reviews about scent. I have tried a lot of brands finding the 2 scents that are mild yet welcoming smell making me look forward to the shower. This Pine Tar and another companies Golden Moss. I don’t feel clean unless I use Pine Tar soap.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos S. Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Really nice soap
customer_reviews.text: Good abrasion for getting gunk off my hands. Nice pine tar scent. Makes my hands feel nice after. also shows you when its time to clean your sink because the soap scum is black, and it shows when it builds up.
customer_reviews.author: UNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: Great soap!
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this soap, and I have to say it is the best soap if all the others I tried. Smells great and not over powering. The lathering is not the best, but good enough, and it does the job. I get that clean and smooth feeling after every shower. Overall I'm very happy with this soap, and the price is very good. I will be ordering this soap on a regular basis as long as it doesn't change like in quality. Great soap! Keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Good bar of soap
customer_reviews.text: I never tried pine tar soap and was intrigued by another brand’s ad. I didn’t want To pay the price for it, so I opted for this brand instead. Nice piney smell that isn’t too overwhelming. Cleans your skin well and leaves a subtle fragrance behind. Just make sure to rinse your body and the shower well because of it’s black color.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: good bar of natural soap for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a few weeks now. It smells good and lathers up nicely, and still leaves me feeling clean. For the money this is a pretty good buy and I will probably continue to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: KVH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect except the ground oatmeal and silica feels like sandpaper
customer_reviews.text: If you only ever wash with a washcloth this is perfect for you. If not the oatmeal feels as sharp as course sandpaper. Smell is great, lathers fine, cleans well, but sandpaper like crushed shells actually hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Ben

customer_reviews.title: Best soap I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Great soap. It cleared up my dry skin. Was trying out natural soaps and found that mostly all of them did nothing. I'd get out of the shower and still smell like body odor. Not this stuff, it works like it should and does not dry me out.
customer_reviews.author: charleen Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Changed shape and packaging
customer_reviews.text: Just curious why they changed the shape from square to brick? The packaging is also changed from paper to plastic. It seems that the smell is different also. I prefer the original shape and smell. What’s going on? Change of ownership?
customer_reviews.author: David James

customer_reviews.title: The smell is just like that other more expensive and smaller bar of cartoon soap
customer_reviews.text: Yes I've had several bars of the pine tar "bigfoot" soap, and I really love it, but it's much too expensive. This Olivery Rocket stuff on the other hand is much cheaper and smells the same, so I think I'll be a return customer of this Oliver Rocket brand instead of the squatch.
customer_reviews.author: benjamin johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good soap, but doesn’t last too long
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it doesn’t last long. 2 weeks is the average lifespan. Pretty much identical to Squatch soap. The scent is awesome and I really look forward to using it every day lol! Really wish I could get closer to 3-4 weeks from one bar though. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered the 3 bar pack 4 times. I don't know how people can use the full bar in less than a week. I shower and shave with it daily and it lasts 3 to 4 weeks. Great sent, good wash and amazing price!
customer_reviews.author: Shane Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Good Value compared to other fancy soap brands 2. Great Scent- Wife approved. 3. Great exfoliating properties with the oatmeal added in 4. Skin feels great after Cons: 1. Scent doesn't last too long so it is better if you are a person who showers at night 2. If you have sensitive skin oatmeal exfoliant may be a bit rough- may not be for you if you don't like "Scratchy" soaps. Overall, exactly what I was looking for and a solid Pine-Tar soap experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and lasts longer than Squatch
customer_reviews.text: Bigger and better than Squatch soap..lasts bout a week longer..seems identical to Bigfoot soap for the scent and lather but doesnt have the wood chips like Squatch..pack of 3 is 20 bucks...1 bar of bigfoot is 10..will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Silvers

customer_reviews.title: Feels like I"m really getting clean with this soap.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the soap for a week now and very satisfied. Feels odd to wash with black soap but I really do like the results. Believe I'll continue with this product. For me one bar is good for about 8-10 showers, not bad really considering how clean it makes you feel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great soap. Great scent. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Have tried many pine tar soaps. This is by far the best soap and the best value. Lathers nicely, leaves skin conditioned and feeling alive. Fantastic product and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Good but plastic wrapping
customer_reviews.text: I like this soap a lot. It last longer than Dr. Squatch and is just good overall quality. The only thing I dislike is the packaging. When they first had these bars I liked the pseudo paper wrapping that they had. The past two times I bought it to revisit as a possible forever soap they’ve been covered all over in plastic, which is the only thing that keeps me not wanting to purchase this soap.
customer_reviews.author: ISMAEL DELUNA

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This soap leaves your skin soft and clean, but I wasn’t a fan of the scent. It reminds me of hotel soap. It also became mushy quickly, so a wire soap rack would be ideal, as oppose to a regular soap dish.
customer_reviews.author: Chella

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and better value than the DR.S
customer_reviews.text: This soap is GREAT! The scent in the shower is woodsy and refreshing. When you get out from your little vacation of a shower you feel clean!! I switched from dr. Squatch because paying 9-10 dollars for a 4oz bar that lasts less than a week was a little too pricey for my blood. For 13 dollars you get THREE 6oz bars. If you want a comparable (in my opinion better) bar. Look no further. This is it! Buy it now
customer_reviews.author: Zakaria Tutah

customer_reviews.title: Best soap EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first all natural pine tar soap I got. I loved it!!!! Then made the mistake on trying a different brand pin tar soap.... never again!!! Always sticking to this one! The smell is amazing!! Just an all around awesome bar of soap. I also noticed that they made the bars even bigger than before, that’s a huge plus!
customer_reviews.author: Petey

customer_reviews.title: Leaves me feeling super clean.
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical, when i got the soap was worried i'd smell like a granpa with cologne but damn this soap leaves me feeling so clean. I really like it, will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F.T.

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing scent
customer_reviews.text: I very surprised ho much I like this soap. I bought for husband but the scent is so refreshing I had to try it. So now both of us are using. Moisturizing.
customer_reviews.author: Risky734

customer_reviews.title: Dissolving soap!
customer_reviews.text: So this soap smells good. But that's about all of the good qualities. It makes a huge mess of your shower stall because it basically melts in the water. I get about 7-8 showers out of each bar which is not good enough for the price. It becomes very soft when in the water and coats your shower in slick black streaks of soap. It just doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Corbitt

customer_reviews.title: Mom likes it for eczema
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my mom who has problems with eczema. She loves it. After she washes with it and dries she applies some goat's milk lotion and the spots have been clearing up.
customer_reviews.author: debbie700

customer_reviews.title: Great soap for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Dr. Squatch Pine Tar soap, but the price was just insane. So I ordered this just to check it out, and I think I have found the pine tar soap Holy Grail. Much less expensive, smells great, lathers great and the bars are huge. And it is made with great ingredients. Keep up the good work , Oliver Rocket.
customer_reviews.author: godzillajay

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SOAP , I LIKE IT !
customer_reviews.text: Basically, I like the soap,the scent and how it feels. The pine scent does not last that long though. Would of liked the bars to be in individually wrapped packages. I like that the ingredients are natural too. This is a great "chemical free , Paraben free " soap alternative.
customer_reviews.author: RichC

customer_reviews.title: Smells Good Feels Good
customer_reviews.text: A great soap at a great price! A bold fresh scent (pine tar)that lasts without being overbearing! A nice size bar that will last if cared for properly. Any good soap with more natural ingredients should be allowed to air out and dry so it doesn’t turn into a gel. If you take the time to do this you will find the bar does last a lot longe And not disintegrate in your hands. Will order again and recommend this soap!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lum

customer_reviews.title: Great soap! This last longer than other Pine Tar ...
customer_reviews.text: Great soap! This last longer than other Pine Tar soaps that I've tried and smells great! If you're looking for a manly smelling, exfoliating soap look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaves skin feeling dry and occasionally irritated.
customer_reviews.text: Great for an occasional body exfoliation, but I would never use this on my face and would advise against using it every day in general. If you have oily skin, this will definitely dry you up, but I discovered that using it for days in a row would lead to itchy, dry skin fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Stuff will leave black soap residue... But altogether a great product
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews, but can honestly say this stuff is great. The estimate of it lasting 7-10 days is accurate per bar. Good stuff though. I would caution you that it will leave black soap residue wherever you leave it when done using it... so be aware of that. Great product though and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dance

customer_reviews.title: Pine Tar Soap solving my problem
customer_reviews.text: I have itches on my skin,and some on my hairline. basing on my google search, i found pine tar soap to be the most natural help.this soap is indeed improving my skin problem. my observation is when i use it to my scalp, i noticed that my hair is becoming brittle. i wish it can also contain something to condition my hair. Thanks Oliver Rocket, your pine tar soap is helping me.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Martin

customer_reviews.title: I have been looking for a good Pine Tar soap for awhile now
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good Pine Tar soap for awhile now. All the good ones cost around 10 dollars a bar which is not worth it to me. These are pretty much the same for half the cost. Great soap with a light texture, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Taxman

customer_reviews.title: Smells like comet
customer_reviews.text: It was an ok soap. The smell was initially pine-ish when first showering and then came out smelling like comet (the cleaner). It was really weird how much it smelled like comet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nunes

customer_reviews.title: This is all I use now
customer_reviews.text: Sensitive skinned ginger kid here. Scent is earthy and awesome. Bars last a long time. Doesn’t exacerbate my eczema or the kids. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: John Weller

customer_reviews.title: A+ great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Everything as described and better than expected. I love the scent, the lather and clean skin afterwards. I’ll be buying this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Putney

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy the fact that this soap contains sand and oatmeal ...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the fact that this soap contains sand and oatmeal as it seems to exfoliate really well. The scent is good but not what I would expect from a pine tar soap and is more perfume than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a great clean
customer_reviews.text: This soap really holds up in the shower. It provides a rich lather with a cleansing grit that combine to leave you with a smooth, glowing skin.
customer_reviews.author: ReadsGlass

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the shower and the shave
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite soap. It has a pleasant, not overpowering, fragrance and it lathers black. I’m bald and I prefer this soap over any shaving cream or butter that I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmahmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Smells good
customer_reviews.text: The Oliver Rocket pine tar soap has a pleasing smell that is like standing in a forest. It has a slightly rough texture that exfoliates and it rinses off clean. This soap is very comparable to other much more expensive soap products.
customer_reviews.author: kathy sells

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be very similar to the Dr. Squatch pine tar and it is. Who came up with the scent and black soap? I have no idea. But I like it and the Oliver Rocket version is very affordable. Lasts about as long as Dr. Squatch maybe slightly longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like Squatch
customer_reviews.text: Just as good of quality as Squatch. Lathers well and good exfoliation action. Would choose this over squatch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bo-jangles

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The soap smells good, lasts long and has an interesting texture. I just ordered a second 3-bar set. My only complaint (and it's minor) is that it's square shaped which makes it a little harder to hold than a typical rectangular bar.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a gimmick black soap that sheds its dye and turns everything it touches black. It makes a mess and cleans nothing. I threw it away after trying it. STAY AWAY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roan Purgatory

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for sensitive skin and eczema
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a good soap for sensitive skin and eczema. It smells great too, the wife loves it. It can feel a little rough at first with the exfoliating properties of the bar but once it lathers well it feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hatoum

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended soap
customer_reviews.text: My favorite soap. The soap lasts a decent amount time if you dont leave it in anything that puddles or in direct water flow. I appreciate the exfoliation as well as the scent. If you've seen the more well advertised version from the competitor, this one is equally as good, if not better and at a cheaper price. Highly recommend this soap.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Best Esthetic Pine Tar Soap Value!
customer_reviews.text: This soap had a very pleasing smell and lathered really well. It was packaged in three large bricks. It’s nice to have a lather thick enough to transfer to the feet without having to directly lather the feet. This is the best all around value Pine Tar Soap.
customer_reviews.author: Barry D. White

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: It’s quite large which makes it that much better for the price. It smells good and lathers well.
customer_reviews.author: Marie parrish

customer_reviews.title: Use this soap!
customer_reviews.text: As a man who works outside, in a hot, humid environment, the issue of masculine hygiene is high on my list. Shower time is healing time, right alongside with meal time, and rest. This soap helps with the man itch, and the humidity sweat film. After a long shift the relaxing aroma, and feeling of clean, this soap gives is unparalleled. I highly recommend to anyone who works their arse off.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great soap at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this soap. I did use some of the higher-marketed ones for years, but this gives you the same bang for the buck. I only gave the scent 4 stars because I think some people want to get a strong presence when they shower. This is good, but not as powerful as some of the others I used. It lathers great and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kohan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t smell like pine at all
customer_reviews.text: The bar only lasted 5 days. It turns everything black and doesn’t smell like pine. Not happy with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best soap I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Best soap I've used to date. At this price I don't have plans on using any other brand period. Great soap for whole body. A little goes a long way. Perfect balance. I have both dry and oily skin. This soap seems to even everything out. Can't explain it. It just does. Scent is top notch. Very natural smelling pine tar. Not overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good soap with a good price
customer_reviews.text: Started with dr squatch. Their soap was good but too small for the price. Went searching for an alternative and found OR soap This pine tar soap is great and smells great. The size of the bar and shape are just right and will make it more than four showers As long as this 3 pack is at this price I feel you can’t beat this stuff. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mark

product_meta.title: Oliver Rocket Pine Tar Soap - Men's Face and Body Soap with Pine Tar Extract and Charcoal - Homemade in USA with Coconut Oil and Olive Oil (3 Bar Set)
feature_bullets: Handmade soap bar quality engineered for successful men; soap 100% homemade, created in the USA
Luxurious black soap crafted to leave skin feeling soft, smooth, and incredible; the perfect gift for a birthday or Father's Day
The exfoliating and detoxifying soap is blended with charcoal, and is suitable for sensitive skin
A multipurpose bar, functions as hand, beard, and body soap
Comes in a set of three 6 oz bars; crafted with with saponified oils of coconut oil and vegetable oil, olive oil, shea butter, activated charcoal, sea salt, pine tar extract, oatmeal, and fragrance

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
